results.title: Pacific terminal
results.creator_credit: Government of NSW and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: A survey of the capital city of New South Wales, Sydney on Port Jackson. Includes aerial footage of Sydney; monuments in Macquarie Place; inland footage of shearers and bullocks hauling logs; and Australians enjoying a range of recreational activities.

results.title: This is Victoria: Australia
results.brief_description: Silent footage of parts of Victoria and its people from the 1950s produced to promote Victoria. “The Rip” is the first sequence lasting approximately three minutes, where a family park the car to take in the view. They watch large cargo ships traverse the narrow entrance to Port Phillip Bay known as The Rip. Point Lonsdale is shown - the main street (full of fabulous cars from the era) and the lighthouse. Family beach fun is shown as children play in the shallows, people sunbake or rest in the shade of an umbrella, knit, go camping, wash baby in a big plastic tub, walk over the dunes, go surfing or play ballgames. “The Rose Chapel of St Helena” is a sequence approximately two minutes long about a small church in the Eltham/Greensborough area but before getting to that area there are a couple of shots of the City of Melbourne. The Chapel is shown, as are the gravestones from the 1850s that surround the chapel of this small Church of England. Some patrons and a clergyman are also in attendance. “Yarra Bridges” is the final sequence lasting about three minutes and it has some wonderful views of Melbourne and the Bridges that cross the Yarra River. St Pauls Cathedral over Princes Bridge, a view of the Governor’s Residence, cars, trains and assorted automobiles, a white helmeted policeman directing traffic, construction of pillars for a new bridge, the swing bridge at Yarra Bend and a Yarra River Boat Cruise are all shown.

results.title: Family antics
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Dad sits down to enjoy a beer in the back garden and listen to the news but sees his son has other ideas, and forces him to do acrobatic tricks.

results.title: Australia presents: Christmas in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. The old traditions are preserved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.
description_for_label: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.

results.title: A Place to live
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy
results.brief_description: Story of immigration and discussion of how newcomers look for houses, units or commission housing on offer in the city. Immigration officers help migrants get loans and settle in ‘suburbia’, the ideal for many migrants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy

results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 3
results.brief_description: Fly fishermen perfect their art for annual assault on trout streams - skill in manipulating the finely woollen line is acquired only after years of patient practice; Australian National Airways take delivery of newest DC-6B airline ‘Beltana’ (arrival at Essendon Airport); Hakoah force Moreland to replay in exciting Dockerty Cup semi-final (soccer).

results.title: [Royal guest XVI Olympiad 1956]
results.brief_description: A historical record of Prince Philip’s visit to Melbourne during the 1956 Olympic Games. Captures his airport arrival; the public lining Melbourne’s streets to greet the Prince; his visit to Government House; a parade on Swanston street showing a glimpse of Melbourne Town Hall; the opening ceremony at Olympic Games; Robert Menzies and Prince Philip arriving at the Olympic stadium; entrance of athletes at the opening ceremony; Ron Clarke’s memorable entrance into the stadium and the lighting of the Olympic flame; footage of Station Pier in Port Melbourne; Philip arriving at St Paul’s cathedral in Melbourne; an extensive tour of the accomodation facilities prepared for the athletes at Olympic Village in Heidelberg; Philip visit a hospital and the Australian Paper Manufacturers mill in Heidelberg; shows footage of various track and field events in the stadium; a ceremony at Melbourne’s Shrine of Rememberance; the departure of Prince Philip.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.
